newsitem.title: UK: UK Labour's lead at four-year low - poll.
newsitem.headline: UK Labour's lead at four-year low - poll.

text.p: The opposition Labour Party's lead has dropped to its lowest point for four years, according to the latest opinion poll in the run-up to the May 1 election.
The NOP poll for the Sunday Times showed Labour down three points in a week to 45 percent. The ruling Conservatives, bidding for a fifth election win in a row, garnered 31 percent, up three.
The poll showed voters preferred the Conservatives as the best party to manage Britain's booming economy and keep taxes down.

But splits within the Conservatives over Britain's role in the European Union have hit the ruling party which depicted Labour leader Tony Blair in its campaign advertisements as a German puppet who would cave in to Chancellor Helmut Kohl.
The poll showed 48 percent believed Blair would make the stronger prime minister compared to 29 percent for Major.
